intro: Aconogonon molle var. rude, commonly known as the roughleaf aconogonon, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are rough to the touch, giving it its common name. It produces clusters of violet or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
